raw_text:
Everton's Weir cools Euro hopes
 
 Everton defender David Weir has played down talk of European football, despite his team lying in second place in the Premiership after beating Liverpool.
 
 Weir told BBC Radio Five Live: "We don't want to rest on our laurels and say we have achieved anything yet. "I think you start taking your eye off the ball if you make statements and look too far into the future. "If you start making predictions you soon fall back into trouble. The only thing that matters is the next game." He said: "We are looking after each other and hard work goes a long way in this league. We have definitely shown that. "Also injuries and suspensions haven't cost us too badly and we have a lot of self-belief around the place."
llama3.2:1b: Everton defender David Weir has downplayed Euro hopes, saying he wants to keep playing each game and not focus on future results.
llama3.2:3b: Everton defender David Weir has played down talk of European football, saying team's focus should be on next game rather than future aspirations or predictions, and emphasizing hard work and teamwork as keys to success.
gemma2:2b: David Weir downplays talk of European football, stating Everton should focus on the next game rather than making predictions about future success.
He believes hard work and team spirit are key to their current position in the league despite facing injuries and suspensions.
qwen2.5:0.5b: David Weir, Everton's defender, has expressed confidence about continuing to improve despite his team finishing second in their Premiership after beating Liverpool.
He believes it’s important not to get caught up in future predictions and focuses more on current game results.
qwen2.5:1.5b: Everton defender David Weir maintains the team has not achieved anything yet, advising against making predictions for future games.
His team is second in the Premier League after beating Liverpool, with emphasis on hard work being crucial to success in the league despite injuries and suspensions.
qwen2.5:3b: Everton's David Weir dismisses talk of European football, stressing the importance of focused effort on current matches rather than long-term aspirations.
He emphasizes maintaining focus on each game and highlights team unity, minimal injury and suspension issues, and strong belief as key factors.
opencoder:1.5b:
Everton's Weir cools Euro hopes 

Weir, a man who has always been committed to football, was right on his word.

Despite his team's position in the Premier League being second when they faced Liverpool, Liverpool midfielder David Allen remained dominant, and he promised not to rest on his laurels for European football.
The idea that Weir had achieved anything yet, as he told BBC Radio Five Live, seemed unsettling.
He said he wouldn't be making any statements or looking too far into the future, as he was confident he would make accurate predictions and soon fall back into trouble if he misled the team.
The sport was a game of self-belief and hard work that came together over time.
However, it wasn’t until he made a case that injuries and suspensions didn't have any significant impact on him that he began to see value in his role as a footballer.
smollm:1.7b: Everton defender David Weir has played down talk of European football, despite his team lying in second place in the Premiership after beating Liverpool.
deepseek-r1:1.5b:
Summarized text:
Everton's defender David Weir has signaled a cautious outlook regarding Europe's football, despite his team's second-place position.
He advises fans to be realistic about European progress and emphasizes the value of hard work and self-belief.
tinyllama:1.1b: The Everton defender David Weihr has dismissed talk of European football, despite his team being currently in second place in the Premier League after beating Liverpool.

Weihr told BBC Radio Five Live that he does not want to focus too much on achieving anything beyond his team's current standing, and emphasized the importance of self-belief and hard work in a competitive league like the Premier League.
He also noted that injuries and suspensions have not detracted from the team's performance or caused them to take their eye off the ball in terms of goals.

Although they are currently in second place, Weir feels that the team should not rest on its laurels and continues to work hard for every game.
Despite discussions regarding potential European football, Weir emphasizes that focusing only on individual accolades could hinder the team's growth.
Instead, they prioritize maintaining their performance and hard work.

They are focused on winning each game through hard work and self-belief.
Injuries and suspensions have not negatively impacted them.

He added that injuries and suspensions have not significantly affected their performance and that they have enough self-belief.
